{
  "article_text": [
    "the notion of borromean surgery was introduced by matveev in @xcite as an example of what he called a @xmath2-surgery . since then",
    ", this transformation has become the elementary move of goussarov - habiro finite type invariants theory for oriented @xmath0-manifolds ( @xcite , @xcite , @xcite ) .",
    "matveev showed that the equivalence relation , among closed oriented @xmath0-manifolds , generated by borromean surgery is characterized by the pair : @xmath3 where @xmath4 is the first betti number of a @xmath0-manifold @xmath5 and @xmath6 is its torsion linking form .",
    "this result gives a characterization of degree @xmath7 invariants in goussarov - habiro theory for closed oriented @xmath0-manifolds .",
    "as mentioned by habiro and goussarov , their finite type invariants theory ( in short : `` fti theory '' ) makes sense also for @xmath0-manifolds with spin structure because borromean surgeries work well with spin structures ( see  [ sec : spinmove ] ) .",
    "so , the question is : _ what is the `` spin '' analogue of matveev s theorem ? _",
    "+ for each closed spin @xmath0-manifold @xmath8 , a quadratic form @xmath9 can be defined by many ways ( see @xcite , @xcite , and also @xcite , @xcite ) .",
    "the bilinear form associated to @xmath10 is @xmath11 .",
    "its gauss - brown invariant is equal to @xmath12 modulo @xmath1 , where @xmath13 is the rochlin function of @xmath5 , sending a spin structure @xmath14 of @xmath5 to the modulo @xmath15 signature of a spin @xmath16-manifold which spin - bounds @xmath8 .",
    "the main result of this paper is the following refinement of matveev s theorem :    [ th : main ] let @xmath8 and @xmath17 be connected closed spin @xmath0-manifolds .",
    "+ then , the following assertions are equivalent :    1 .",
    "@xmath8 and @xmath17 can be obtained from one another by spin borromean surgeries , 2 .",
    "there exists a homology isomorphism @xmath18 such that : @xmath19 3 .",
    "@xmath20 modulo @xmath1 and there exists a homology isomorphism @xmath18 such that : @xmath21    the equivalence between assertions 2 and 3 will be the topological statement of an algebraic fact : a nondegenerate quadratic form on a finite abelian group is determined , up to isomorphism , by its associated bilinear form and its gauss - brown invariant .",
    "+ in  [ sec : defmove ] we recall matveev s notion of @xmath2-surgery . with this background",
    ", we then recall the definition of borromean surgery , and give equivalent descriptions of other authors .",
    "+ in  [ sec : spinmove ] , we clarify how all of these notions have to be understood in the spin case : in particular , spin borromean surgeries are introduced . as a motivation to theorem [ th : main ] , fti for spin @xmath0-manifolds , in the sense of habiro and goussarov , are then defined : the rochlin invariant is shown to be a finite type degree @xmath22 invariant .",
    "it should be mentioned that cochran and melvin have proposed a different fti theory in @xcite , and have also refined their theory to the case of spin manifolds .",
    "+  [ sec : algquad ] is of an algebraic nature .",
    "we recall some definitions and results about quadratic forms on finite abelian groups .",
    "we also prove the above mentioned algebraic fact : the proof makes use of kawauchi - kojima classification of linking pairings .",
    "+  [ sec : topquad ] is the topological cousin of the former : we review the quadratic form @xmath10 . starting from turaev @xmath16-dimensional definition in @xcite",
    ", we then give an intrinsic definition for @xmath10 ( no reference to dimension @xmath16 ) .",
    "+  [ sec : proof ] is devoted to the proof of theorem [ th : main ] .",
    "it goes as a refinement of the original proof by matveev for the `` unspun '' case .",
    "last section will give some of its applications .",
    "the author wants to thank his advisor pr .",
    "christian blanchet who supervised this work , and florian deloup for conversations regarding quadratic forms .",
    "he is also indebted to flicie pastore for correcting his written english .",
    "first of all , we want to recall the _",
    "unifying _ idea of @xmath2-surgery by matveev in @xcite . this will allow us to have a more conceptual view of borromean surgeries .",
    "we begin with some general definitions .",
    "a _ matveev triple _ is a triple of oriented @xmath0-manifolds : @xmath23 where @xmath24 is closed and is the union of @xmath25 and @xmath26 along their common boundary @xmath27 , as depicted in figure  [ fig : triple ] .",
    "+ the triple @xmath28 is called the _ inverse _ of @xmath2 and is denoted by @xmath29 .",
    "let now @xmath5 be a closed oriented @xmath0-manifold and let @xmath30 be an orientation - preserving embedding .",
    "form the following closed oriented @xmath0-manifold : @xmath31    with the above notations , @xmath32 is said to be obtained from @xmath5 by _ @xmath2-surgery along @xmath33_.    note that if @xmath34 denotes the embedding of @xmath26 in @xmath32 , then @xmath5 is obtained from @xmath32 by @xmath29-surgery along @xmath34 .",
    "two matveev triples @xmath2 and @xmath35 are said to be _ equivalent _ if there exists an orientation - preserving diffeomorphism from @xmath24 to @xmath36 sending @xmath25 to @xmath37 , and @xmath26 to @xmath38 .",
    "note that , if the triples @xmath2 and @xmath35 are equivalent , then they have the same surgery effect .",
    "[ ex : triple ] let @xmath39 denote the genus @xmath40 closed oriented surface and let @xmath41 be the genus @xmath40 oriented handlebody .",
    "then , each orientation - preserving diffeomorphism @xmath42 leads to a triple : @xmath43 a @xmath44-surgery amounts to `` twist '' an embedded genus @xmath40 handlebody by @xmath45 .",
    "for instance , from the standard genus one heegaard decomposition of @xmath46 , integral dehn surgery is recovered .",
    "the original matveev s point of view was :    a _ borromean surgery _ is a @xmath47-surgery with : @xmath48 where the `` halves '' @xmath49 and @xmath50 are obtained from the genus @xmath0 handlebody by surgery on three - component framed links as shown in figure [ fig : halves ] .",
    ".,width=377,height=188 ]    we now recall goussarov s notion of _ @xmath51-surgery _ in @xcite .",
    "this move is equivalent to the _ @xmath52-move _ of habiro in @xcite .",
    "[ def : ygraph ] a _ @xmath51-graph _ @xmath53 in a closed oriented @xmath0-manifold @xmath5 is an ( unoriented ) embedding of the surface drawn in figure [ fig : y ] , together with its decomposition between _ leaves _ , _ edges _ and _ node_. + the closed oriented @xmath0-manifold _ obtained from @xmath5 by @xmath51-surgery along @xmath53 _ is : @xmath54 where @xmath55 is a regular neighbourhood of @xmath53 in @xmath5 , and @xmath56 is the surgered handlebody on the six - component link @xmath57 drawn on figure [ fig : l ] . +",
    "we call _ @xmath51-equivalence _ the equivalence relation among closed oriented @xmath0-manifolds generated by orientation - preserving diffeomorphisms and @xmath51-surgeries",
    ".        -graph.,width=207,height=151 ]    note that a @xmath51-surgery is a @xmath58-surgery if we call @xmath58 the triple : @xmath59 the corresponding @xmath51-graph gives the place where the @xmath58-surgery must be performed .",
    "[ lem : eqby ] the matveev triples @xmath47 and @xmath58 are equivalent .",
    "thus , borromean surgery is equivalent to @xmath51-surgery .",
    "we will show that both of the triples @xmath47 and @xmath58 are equivalent to a triple @xmath60 , defined by an orientation - preserving diffeomorphism @xmath61 . + we start with the `` half '' @xmath56 of figure [ fig : l ] : handle - sliding of each node - component over the corresponding leaf - component , followed by some isotopies of framed links gives figure [ fig : linter ] , where only part of the link is drawn .     of figure",

    "note that during this push - off , none of the three components @xmath66 is intersected .",
    "then , the components @xmath66 can also be pushed off so that the framing correction is now @xmath67 : the result is a family of three disjoint curves @xmath68 .",

    ", is the surgery move among closed spin @xmath0-manifolds defined equivalently by the triples @xmath58 or @xmath47 .",
    "we call _ @xmath153-equivalence _ the equivalence relation among them generated by spin diffeomorphisms and @xmath153-surgeries .",

    "[ lem : associativity ] let @xmath8 be a closed spin @xmath0-manifold and let @xmath53 and @xmath160 be disjoint @xmath51-graphs in @xmath5 .",
    "then , up to diffeomorphism of manifolds with spin structure , @xmath161    the equality @xmath162 is obvious . by construction , both of @xmath163 and @xmath164 are extensions of @xmath165 .",

    "following habiro and goussarov definition of a finite type invariant ( @xcite , @xcite ) , we can now define :    [ def : spinfti ] let @xmath170 be an abelian group and let @xmath171 be an @xmath170-valued invariant of @xmath0-manifolds with spin structure .",
    "then , @xmath171 is an _ invariant of degree at most @xmath92 _ if for any closed spin @xmath0-manifold @xmath8 and any family @xmath168 of at least @xmath172 @xmath51-graphs in @xmath5 , the following identity holds : @xmath173 where the sum is taken over all subfamilies @xmath174 of @xmath168 .",
    "moreover , @xmath171 is _ of degree @xmath92 _ if it is of degree at most @xmath92 , but is not of degree at most @xmath175 .",
    "note that the degree @xmath7 invariants are precisely those invariants which are constant on each @xmath153-equivalence class .",
    "so , the refined matveev theorem will quantify how powerful they can be .",
    "the next subsection will provide us some examples of invariants which are finite type in the sense of definition [ def : spinfti ] .      [",

    "[ cor : rochlin ] the rochlin invariant is a degree @xmath22 invariant of closed spin @xmath0-manifolds for goussarov - habiro theory , and its modulo @xmath1 reduction is of degree @xmath7 .    in cochran - melvin theory ,",
    "the rochlin invariant is a degree @xmath0 finite type invariant ( see ( * ? ?",
    "6.2 ) ) .",
    "last statement is clear from proposition [ prop : rochlin ] and from the fact that the rochlin function of the @xmath0-torus takes values in @xmath188 .",
    "let us show that the rochlin invariant is at most of degree @xmath22 .",
    "take a closed spin @xmath0-manifold @xmath8 and two disjoint @xmath51-graphs @xmath53 and @xmath160 in @xmath5 .",

    "but this follows from definition of the maps @xmath191 and from the fact that @xmath194 extends @xmath195 .",
    "+ it remains to show that the rochlin invariant is not of degree @xmath7 ( and so it will be `` exactly '' of degree @xmath22 ) .",
    "for instance , all of the spin structures of the @xmath0-torus are related one to another by @xmath153-surgeries ( _ cf _ example [ ex : torus ] below ) and so are not distinguished one to another by degree @xmath7 invariants .",
    "but rochlin distinguishes one of them from the others .",
    "we call @xmath196 the @xmath0-manifold obtained from @xmath46 by surgery along a ordered oriented framed link @xmath197 of length @xmath198 , and @xmath199 the corresponding @xmath16-manifold obtained from @xmath200 by attaching @xmath114-handles and sometimes called the _ trace _ of the surgery . let also @xmath201 be the linking matrix of @xmath57 .",

    "+ the following lemma , more general than needed , will allow us to enunciate in those terms the effect of a @xmath153-surgery .",

    "+ we define @xmath240 . by hypothesis 1",
    ", there exists a unique spin structure @xmath241 of @xmath196 with @xmath242 as associated characteristic solution of @xmath224 .",
    "we want to show that @xmath243 .",
    "diagram chasing shows that proving @xmath244 should suffice .",
    "this follows from hypothesis 2 , formulas ( [ eq : calculdeh ] ) and from the fact that @xmath245 and @xmath246 .",
    "let @xmath5 be a closed oriented @xmath0-manifold and let @xmath158 be obtained from @xmath5 by surgery along a @xmath51-graph @xmath53 .",

    ", each @xmath14 is sent by @xmath247 to @xmath157 .",
    "suppose now that we are given a surgery presentation @xmath248 of @xmath5 .",

    ", we recall a construction due to wall ( see @xcite ) , establishing a one to one correspondence ( up to isomorphism ) between nondegenerate quadratic forms on @xmath114-groups and linking pairings on @xmath114-groups without direct summand of order two .",

    "since @xmath264 is quadratic with respect to the modulo @xmath114 intersection form @xmath418 on @xmath168 , we have : @xmath447+[\\mu]\\right ) \\\\                 & = & q\\left([l]\\right)+q\\left([\\mu]\\right)+[l]\\bullet [ \\mu ] \\\\                 & = & q\\left([l]\\right ) + 1 \\\\                 & = & \\sigma(k , l ) + 1 . \\end{array}\\ ] ]    we now recall the definition of the _ framing number _ @xmath448 of a rationally nulhomologous oriented framed knot @xmath449 in a closed oriented @xmath0-manifold @xmath5 :    _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ choose @xmath450 such that @xmath451=0\\in h_{1}(m)$ ] .",
    "pick a @xmath452-times connected sum of @xmath145 .",

    "then : @xmath453 _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _    [ lem : dim3 ] let @xmath8 be a closed spin @xmath0-manifold and @xmath454 .",
    "choose a smooth oriented knot @xmath145 in @xmath5 representative for @xmath280 , and pick a parallel @xmath198 for @xmath145 satisfying @xmath455 .",
    "then , @xmath456    note that , according to lemma [ lem : framed ] , the rhs of ( [ eq : dim3 ] ) is an invariant of the oriented knot @xmath145 ( it does not depend on the choice of @xmath198 satisfying the above condition ) .",
    "this lemma claims that it only depends on the homology class @xmath280 of @xmath145 , and _ gives a @xmath0-dimensional definition for the quadratic form @xmath10_.    from this lemma , we can see that @xmath10 coincides with the quadratic form defined by lannes and latour in @xcite when specialized to our case ( see also @xcite ) .",
    "consider the @xmath16-manifold @xmath457 obtained from @xmath458 $ ] by attaching a @xmath114-handle to @xmath459 along @xmath449 .",
    "identify @xmath5 with @xmath460 .",
    "since @xmath461 , @xmath14 extends in a unique way to a spin structure @xmath132 of @xmath457 .",
    "+ @xmath462 is then a spin cobordism between @xmath8 and @xmath463 , where @xmath32 is the closed oriented @xmath0-manifold obtained from @xmath5 by the corresponding surgery , and where @xmath464 is the restriction of @xmath132 to @xmath465 .",
    "+ note also that the core of the @xmath114-handle is a @xmath114-disc @xmath466 in @xmath457 with boundary @xmath145 in @xmath5 , and whose normal bundle can be trivialized in accordance with the trivialization of the normal bundle of @xmath145 in @xmath5 given by @xmath198 .",
    "the framed knot @xmath449 will briefly be said to _ have property @xmath467 _ in @xmath457 .",

    "so , @xmath179 is the trace of an even surgery presentation .",

    "+ the following two assertions are equivalent :    1 .   their quadratic forms @xmath10 and @xmath504 are isomorphic , 2 .   their linking forms @xmath11 and @xmath505 are isomorphic , and @xmath20 modulo @xmath1 .",
    "[ cor : top_noloworder ] let @xmath5 be a connected closed oriented @xmath0-manifold , such that @xmath506 does not admit @xmath219 nor @xmath507 as a direct summand .",
    "then , all of its quadratic forms are isomorphic one to another .",
    "part of the work has already been done in previous sections .",
    "first , `` @xmath508 '' follows from corollary [ cor : rochlin ] and from the easy part of ( unspun ) matveev theorem : a @xmath51-surgery preserves homology and torsion linking forms .",
    "this can be verified seeing @xmath51-surgery as a @xmath60-surgery ( where @xmath82 is the borromean diffeomorphism of remark [ rem : fundamental ] ) , using a mayer - vietoris argument and the fact that @xmath82 belongs to the torelli group .",
    "second , `` @xmath509 '' follows from proposition [ prop : lambdaetphi ] .",
    "what remains to be proved is then `` @xmath510 '' . + we start by recalling an algebraic result of durfee ( see @xcite ) about even symmetric bilinear forms on finitely generated free abelian groups .",
    "+ let @xmath511 and @xmath512 be the unimodular even forms whose matrices are respectively : @xmath513    [ def : stable ] let @xmath514 and @xmath515 be two symmetric even bilinear forms on finitely generated free abelian groups .",
    "they are said to be _ stably equivalent _ if they become isomorphic after some stabilizations with unimodular symmetric even bilinear forms .",
    "note that a unimodular even form becomes indefinite after taking direct sum with @xmath82 . recall that every even unimodular indefinite form splits as a direct sum of @xmath82 and @xmath516 ( see for example @xcite ) .",
    "thus , in definition [ def : stable ] , @xmath82 and @xmath516 suffice as unimodular even forms to stabilize .",
    "for @xmath267 an even symmetric bilinear form on a finitely generated free abelian group , we will shortly denote by @xmath517 the quadratic form @xmath518 corresponding to the zero wu class .     "then , the following two assertions are equivalent :    1 .",
    "@xmath514 and @xmath515 are stably equivalent , 2 .",
    "@xmath519 and @xmath520 .",
    "implication `` 1@xmath5212 '' is obvious since @xmath516 and @xmath82 are both unimodular . +",
    "now suppose that condition 2 is satisfied .",
    "for each @xmath522 , there exists a nondegenerate symmetric bilinear form @xmath523 such that : @xmath524 where @xmath525 ( note that it is free ) , @xmath526 , and @xmath527 is the zero form .",
    "the form @xmath528 is still even and @xmath529 and @xmath530 are still isomorphic .",
    "+ consequently , without loss of generality , we can assume both @xmath531 to be nondegenerate .",
    "but this case was treated by durfee in ( * ? ? ?",
    "* corollary 4.2.(ii ) ) .",
    "let @xmath8 and @xmath17 be connected closed spin @xmath0-manifolds such that @xmath532 and @xmath533 .",
    "+ suppose given for them some even surgery presentations @xmath472 and @xmath534 with respective linking matrices @xmath83 and @xmath535 . according to proposition [ prop : durfee ]",
    ", there exists a unimodular integer matrix @xmath215 satisfying for some stabilizations : @xmath536 we have the following geometric realizations of algebraic operations :    1 .",
    "stabilizations by @xmath160 correspond to connected sums with @xmath46 surgery presented on the zero - framed hopf link , 2 .",
    "a stabilization by @xmath537 is concrete when thought of as a connected sum with the poincar sphere surgery presented on an appropriate height - component link as in ( * ? ? ?",
    "* figure 5.3 , p.15 ) , 3 .",
    "congruence by @xmath215 can be realized by some spin kirby moves ( handle - slidings and changes of orientation of components of @xmath57 ) .",
    "the poincar sphere can also be obtained by surgery along a @xmath62-framed trefoil knot ( ( * ? ? ? * figure 5.3 , p.15 ) ) , which can be obtained from the @xmath62-framed unknot by a simple @xmath51-surgery ( see definition [ def : simpley ] ) . as a consequence ,",
    "the poincar sphere and the sphere @xmath46 , equipped with their unique spin structures , are @xmath153-equivalent .",
    "since @xmath153-equivalence is compatible with connected sums , _ we can assume _ that @xmath538 .    a theorem of murakami and nakanishi ( ( * ?",
    "* theorem 1.1 ) ) states that two ordered oriented links have identical linking matrices if and only if they are @xmath539-equivalent .",
    "a @xmath539-move is a certain unknotting operation , which is equivalent to surgery along a simple @xmath51-graph .",
    "+ finally , from corollary [ cor : simpley ] , we see that a simple @xmath153-surgery between even surgery presentations leaves the trivial characteristic solution fixed .",
    "we conclude that @xmath8 is @xmath540-equivalent to @xmath17 , which completes the proof .",
    "according to theorem [ th : main ] , two connected closed spin @xmath0-manifolds are @xmath153-equivalent if and only if they are @xmath51-equivalent as _ plain _ @xmath0-manifolds and their rochlin invariants are identical modulo @xmath1 . in other words , while studying the degree @xmath7 part of goussarov - habiro theory , the spin problem can be `` factored out '' .",
    "now , given a closed connected oriented @xmath0-manifold , one can wonder whether all of its spin structures are @xmath153-equivalent one to another .",
    "this has been verified to be true in the case of @xmath541 by a direct calculation ( example [ ex : torus ] ) .",
    "more generally we have :    [ cor : corofmainth ] let @xmath5 be a connected oriented closed @xmath0-manifold such that @xmath506 has no cyclic direct summand of order @xmath114 or @xmath16 .",
    "then , all spin structures of @xmath5 are @xmath153-equivalent one to another .            c. blanchet , _",

    "@xmath550 ( 1972 ) , 156160 .",
    ", _ non - additivity of the signature _ , invent .",
    "@xmath564 ( 1969 ) , 269274 ."
  ],
  "abstract_text": [
    "<S> in 1986 , matveev defined the notion of borromean surgery for closed oriented @xmath0-manifolds and showed that the equivalence relation generated by this move is characterized by the pair ( first betti number , linking form up to isomorphism ) . </S>",
    "<S> + we explain how this extends for @xmath0-manifolds with spin structure if we replace the linking form by the quadratic form defined by the spin structure . </S>",
    "<S> we then show that the equivalence relation among closed spin @xmath0-manifolds generated by spin borromean surgeries is characterized by the triple ( first betti number , linking form up to isomorphism , rochlin invariant modulo   @xmath1 ) . </S>"
  ]
}
